intro: Stylidium asymmetricum, commonly known as the asymmetric sun-plant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, asymmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique floral structure features a central stamen that is elongated and often curved, which aids in pollination. Stylidium asymmetricum is a small, herbaceous perennial that is often found in coastal and inland regions of Australia.
